Package sheetproject.formula

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Average
    Class that takes the average of values.
    Count
    Class that counts the cells that contain numbers.
    Counta
    Class that counts the cells that are not empty.
    Countif
    Class that counts the cells for which the condition is true.
    If
    Class that counts the cells that contain numbers.
    Int
    Class that converts value to integer.
    Iseven
    Class that considers whether a value is even or not.
    Islogical
    Class that considers whether a value is logical or not.
    Isnumber
    Class that considers whether a value is numeric or not.
    Lower
    Class that converts a string to lower case.
    Max
    Class that returns the max of given values.
    Median
    Class that returns the median of given values (middle item of ordered list).
    Min
    Class that returns the smallest of given values.
    Mod
    Class that returns the rest of a divide operation.
    Not
    Class that returns the opposite of a logical value.
    Or
    Class that returns the outcome of an or operation Arguments: formula, cell, letters =OR(P1,P2) P1 and P2 have to be logical values Use a truth table to check OR If P1 is TRUE and P2 is TRUE, Returns TRUE If P1 is TRUE and P2 is FALSE, Returns TRUE If P1 is FALSE and P2 is TRUE, Returns TRUE If P1 is FALSE and P2 is FALSE, Returns FALSE Can not use ranges Can be nested Example: =OR(TRUE,OR(TRUE,FALSE)) Will return TRUE
    Parser  
    Power
    Class that returns the power of two values.
    Product
    Class that returns the product of two values.
    Proper
    Class that returns all words with the first letter characterized and the rest to lower case.
    Rounddown
    Class that returns the value rounded down.
    Roundup
    Class that returns the value rounded up.
    Sign
    Class that returns the sign of a value: 1 for positive, -1 for negative, 0 for 0.
    Sqrt
    Class that returns the square root of a value.
    Sum
    Class that returns the sum of two values or returns the sum of a range of values.
    Sumif
    Returns the sum if the condition is evaluated TRUE Arguments: formula, cell, value =SUMIF(PARAM1:PARAM2,COND) Sum the range from PARAM1 to PARAM2, for which the condition COND returns TRUE Can be nested
